answers.answer: Hi Charlie,Well to begin with you are anemic, according to your lab work. This would explain the way you are feeling. See a hematologist right away. Once you have given him/her your health history and that of your family he/she will tell you if a visit to a nephrologist is in order. Understand, that anemia left untreated is dangerous. It can and will effect other organs and can cause irriversible dementia.

question: I was wondering if it is normal to have blood in urine, along with mucus. I have had 2 urine tests done by my MD.  The PH he said was 6.5, Esterase- small amount,  bacteria,- few, WBC & RBC 6.0, Epithelial Cells were occasinal. When I was 6 years old I was diagnosed with Brights Disease/ Nephrist.  My father died at the age of 63 with renal kidney failure, and he was also a diabetic.Along with my father 2 of his sisters, his mother, and 3 of her sisters all passed away from kidney disease. I doctored for 6 years for my Brights Disease.  I am now hvaing symptons of Blurred Vision, Fatigue, puffiness in my face, hands, feet, back pain, off and on around my waist area. I have blood test done for my Hemoglobon in 6/07, it was 6.2, then again in 8/07 and it was 6.3, and finally in 11/07 and it was 5.9. My doctor has not ordered any since.  At this time he feels nothing is wrong.  The fatigue seems to be getting worse, along with some stomach bloating now.  I was wondering if you had any advise.  I don't want to wait to late if something might be wrong. To much family history of Kidney Disease, and Diabetes.Thank you
title: Charlie7655
